text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition MediaObservationBRIPS

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Media 0..*MediaObservationUvIpsA photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference
id 0..1idID do artefato
meta 0..1MetaMetadados sobre recurso
implicitRules 0..1uriUm conjunto de regras sob as quais este conteúdo foi criado
language 0..1codeIdioma do conteúdo do recurso
text 0..1NarrativeResumo do texto do recurso, para interpretação humana
contained 0..*ResourceRecursos contidos neste artefato
extension 0..*ExtensionConteúdo adicional definido por implementações
modifierExtension 0..*ExtensionExtensões que não podem ser ignoradas
identifier 0..*IdentifierIdentificador(es) da(s) imagem (ns)
basedOn 0..*Reference(ServiceRequest | CarePlan)Procedimento que causou a criação desta mídia
partOf 0..*Reference(Resource)Parte do evento referenciado
status 1..1codeStatus do evento
type 0..1CodeableConceptIPSCódigo do tipo mídia
modality 0..1CodeableConceptO tipo de equipamento/processo utilizado na aquisição da imagem
view 0..1CodeableConceptProjeção da imagem, por exemplo: lateral ou antero-posterior
subject 1..1Reference(PatientBRIPS)De quem/o quê está registrado nesta mídia
id 0..1stringID exclusivo para referência entre elementos
extension 0..*ExtensionConteúdo adicional definido por implementações
reference 1..1stringReferência literal, URL relativa, interna ou absoluta.
type 0..1uriTipo ao qual a referência se refere (por exemplo: Paciente)
identifier 0..1IdentifierReferência lógica, quando a referência literal não é conhecida
display 0..1stringTexto alternativo para este rescurso
encounter 0..1Reference(Encounter)Atendimento associado à esta mídia
created[x] 0..1dateTime, PeriodQuando a mídia foi capturada
issued 0..1instantData/hora em que esta versão foi disponibilizada
operator 0..1Reference(PractitionerBRIPS | PractitionerRoleBRIPS | OrganizationBRIPS | CareTeam | PatientBRIPS | Device | RelatedPerson)A pessoa responsável pela geração da imagem
reasonCode 0..*CodeableConceptMotivo pelo qual a mídia foi criada
bodySite 0..1CodeableConceptParte anatômica observada
deviceName 0..1stringNome do dispositivo/fabricante
device 0..1Reference(Device | DeviceMetric)Dispositivo utilizado para capturar a imagem
height 0..1positiveIntAltura da imagem em pixels (foto/vídeo)
width 0..1positiveIntLargura da imagem em pixels (foto/vídeo)
frames 0..1positiveIntNúmero de frames se > 1 (foto)
duration 0..1decimalDuração em segundos (áudio / vídeo)
content 1..1AttachmentMídia - referência ou dado
note 0..*AnnotationComentários sobre a mídia

Documentation for this format

name: MediaObservationBRIPS
title: MediaObservationBRIPS
description: Este perfil restringe o recurso de Mídia (que é uma observação especializada)

element.short: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference
element.definition: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Um conjunto de regras sob as quais este conteúdo foi criado
element.definition: Um conjunto de regras sob as quais este conteúdo foi criado
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Resumo do texto do recurso, para interpretação humana
element.definition: Resumo do texto do recurso, para interpretação humana
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensões que não podem ser ignoradas
element.definition: Extensões que não podem ser ignoradas

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.comment: The identifier label and use can be used to determine what kind of identifier it is.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Procedimento que causou a criação desta mídia
element.definition: Procedimento que causou a criação desta mídia
element.requirements: Allows tracing of authorization for the event and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: Not to be used to link an event to an Encounter - use Media.encounter for that.[The allowed reference resources may be adjusted as appropriate for the event resource].
element.requirements: E.g. Drug administration as part of a procedure, procedure as part of observation, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Status: preparação | em andamento | não feito | em espera | parou | concluído | inserido com erro | desconhecido
element.comment: A nominal state-transition diagram can be found in the [[event.html#statemachine | Event pattern]] documentationUnknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply.  Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of an event.

element.comment: Not all terminology uses fit this general pattern. In some cases, models should not use CodeableConcept and use Coding directly and provide their own structure for managing text, codings, translations and the relationship between elements and pre- and post-coordination.
element.requirements: Used for filtering what observations are retrieved and displayed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes for high level media categories.

element.short: O tipo de equipamento/processo utilizado na aquisição da imagem
element.definition: O tipo de equipamento/processo na aquisição da imagem

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Detailed information about the type of the image - its kind, purpose, or the kind of equipment used to generate it.

element.short: Projeção da imagem, por exemplo: lateral ou antero-posterior
element.definition: Projeção da imagem, por exemplo: lateral ou antero-posterior

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Imaging view (projection) used when collecting an image.

element.short: De quem/o quê está registrado nesta mídia
element.definition: De quem/o quê está registrado nesta mídia

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: ID exclusivo para referência entre elementos
element.definition: ID exclusivo para referência entre elementos

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Referência literal, URL relativa, interna ou absoluta.
element.definition: Referência literal, URL relativa, interna ou absoluta.
element.comment: Using absolute URLs provides a stable scalable approach suitable for a cloud/web context, while using relative/logical references provides a flexible approach suitable for use when trading across closed eco-system boundaries.   Absolute URLs do not need to point to a FHIR RESTful server, though this is the preferred approach. If the URL conforms to the structure "/[type]/[id]" then it should be assumed that the reference is to a FHIR RESTful server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Tipo ao qual a referência se refere (por exemplo: Paciente)
element.definition: Tipo ao qual a referência se refere (por exemplo: Paciente)
element.comment: This element is used to indicate the type of  the target of the reference. This may be used which ever of the other elements are populated (or not). In some cases, the type of the target may be determined by inspection of the reference (e.g. a RESTful URL) or by resolving the target of the reference; if both the type and a reference is provided, the reference SHALL resolve to a resource of the same type as that specified.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Aa resource (or, for logical models, the URI of the logical model).

element.short: Referência lógica, quando a referência literal não é conhecida
element.definition: Referência lógica, quando a referência literal não é conhecida
element.comment:
When an identifier is provided in place of a reference, any system processing the reference will only be able to resolve the identifier to a reference if it understands the business context in which the identifier is used. Sometimes this is global (e.g. a national identifier) but often it is not. For this reason, none of the useful mechanisms described for working with references (e.g. chaining, includes) are possible, nor should servers be expected to be able resolve the reference. Servers may accept an identifier based reference untouched, resolve it, and/or reject it - see CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.referencePolicy. 

When both an identifier and a literal reference are provided, the literal reference is preferred. Applications processing the resource are allowed - but not required - to check that the identifier matches the literal reference

Applications converting a logical reference to a literal reference may choose to leave the logical reference present, or remove it.

Reference is intended to point to a structure that can potentially be expressed as a FHIR resource, though there is no need for it to exist as an actual FHIR resource instance - except in as much as an application wishes to actual find the target of the reference. The content referred to be the identifier must meet the logical constraints implied by any limitations on what resource types are permitted for the reference.  For example, it would not be legitimate to send the identifier for a drug prescription if the type were Reference(Observation|DiagnosticReport).  One of the use-cases for Reference.identifier is the situation where no FHIR representation exists (where the type is Reference (Any).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: This is generally not the same as the Resource.text of the referenced resource.  The purpose is to identify what's being referenced, not to fully describe it.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the media occurred within.
element.requirements: Links the Media to the Encounter context.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Data/hora em que esta versão foi disponibilizada
element.definition: Data/hora em que esta versão foi disponibilizada
element.comment: It may be the same as the [`lastUpdated` ](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource-definitions.html#Meta.lastUpdated) time of the resource itself.  For Observations that do require review and verification for certain updates, it might not be the same as the `lastUpdated` time of the resource itself due to a non-clinically significant update that does not require the new version to be reviewed and verified again.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: OBR.22 (or MSH.7), or perhaps OBX-19 (depends on who observation made)

element.short: A pessoa responsável pela geração da imagem
element.definition: A pessoa responsável pela geração da imagem

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Motivo pelo qual a mídia foi criada
element.definition: Motivo pelo qual a mídia foi criada
element.comment: Textual reasons can be captured using reasonCode.text.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment:
Only used if not implicit in code found in Observation.code.  In many systems, this may be represented as a related observation instead of an inline component.   

If the use case requires BodySite to be handled as a separate resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension[ bodySite](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-bodysite.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Dispositivo utilizado para capturar a imagem
element.definition: Dispositivo utilizado para capturar a imagem
element.comment: An extension should be used if further typing of the device is needed.  Secondary devices used to support collecting a media can be represented using either extension or through the Observation.related element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Número de frames, se maior que 1 (foto)
element.comment: if the number of frames is not supplied, the value may be unknown. Applications should not assume that there is only one frame unless it is explicitly stated.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: The duration might differ from occurrencePeriod if recording was paused.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: Recommended content types: image/jpeg, image/png, image/tiff, video/mpeg, audio/mp4, application/dicom. Application/dicom can contain the transfer syntax as a parameter.  For media that covers a period of time (video/sound), the content.creationTime is the end time. Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: Not to be used for observations, conclusions, etc. Instead use an [Observation](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html) based on the Media/ImagingStudy resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
